alert.note: Alert for Humboldt (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 12 at 2:46AM PDT until further notice by NWS Elko
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Moderate to Major severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Nevada... Martin Creek Near Paradise Valley affecting Humboldt County. .Warm temperatures will melt snowpack and increase river flows. For the Martin Creek...including Paradise Valley...Major flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Martin Creek Near Paradise Valley. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 7.5 feet, Major flooding occurs. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:25 AM PDT Wednesday the stage was 6.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 2:25 AM PDT Wednesday was 8.2 feet. - Forecast...The river will fall from a moderate flood stage to action stage between 5 and 5.5 feet later this morning, April 12, before rising once again into moderate flood stage of 6.5 feet this afternoon and evening. Another period of increased stream flow at major flood stage is expected this evening before falling back into minor flood stage by early morning of April 13. - Flood stage is 5.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 7.1 feet on 01/13/1980. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (3 am PDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Sat Martin Creek Paradise Valle 5.5 6.9 Wed 2 am PDT 6.7 6.1 5.7 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 445 PM PDT.
